title: When you say "GL HF" but your laner says "F off"

replies.body: I always found the statement "glhf" to be antithetical to what you should be thinking. I understand that its nice to be a good sport, but I think you can do that just by not flaming, emote spamming etc. Why would you wish the person who you are trying to beat good luck? Why would you want them to have fun given that them having fun is completely reliant on them winning. They're not gonna be having fun if their getting stomped the whole game. I remember when people used to say "GLHF" at he beginning of the game, I would just respond with "Thank you".
THeres a difference between taunting, and when you are Cho gath facing Nasus and you just have a dance off waiting for the next minion wave to farm.
Dance-offs are the best form of combat.

I agree.
I'll tell you have fun, but I wish you no luck. I am there to defeat you.
tell them to have luck as well. that's the jeer. it's like saying that you are gonna need some good luck.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=H5lnthX4,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2016-05-29T00:30:23.834+0000)
>
> tell them to have luck as well. that's the jeer. it's like saying that you are gonna need some good luck.

"Good luck. You're gonna need it."

> [{quoted}](name=Gohst,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=H5lnthX4,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-05-28T21:57:02.917+0000)
>
> Why would you want them to have fun given that them having fun is completely reliant on them winning. They're not gonna be having fun if their getting stomped the whole game.

Getting stomped isn't fun, but if you can't have fun without winning you're gonna have a bad time. I love close games whew I feel I played skilfully, win or lose (though ofc I like winning more).
Exactly. Some of my funnest games have been losses (granted I haven't had a satisfying loss since before the juggernaut update, but still)

> [{quoted}](name=Gohst,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=H5lnthX4,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-05-28T21:57:02.917+0000)
>
> I always found the statement "glhf" to be antithetical to what you should be thinking. I understand that its nice to be a good sport, but I think you can do that just by not flaming, emote spamming etc. Why would you wish the person who you are trying to beat good luck? Why would you want them to have fun given that them having fun is completely reliant on them winning. They're not gonna be having fun if their getting stomped the whole game. I remember when people used to say "GLHF" at he beginning of the game, I would just respond with "Thank you".

Good luck could also refer to "I hope your computer doesn't shut down/I hope spaghetti code doesnt make this a dumb game/ I hope you don't bug splat for no reason"
For me, it's a habit from Starcraft. ;P
That's no fun, I always flash my champion mastery after killing someone.

Every time someone says "GL HF" I always respond with "Gull Hoof"

I have no idea what the fuck is wrong with me
That's the kind of joke I want in my games. Thanks.

> [{quoted}](name=HayRoss,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=H5lnthX4,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-05-28T23:58:02.005+0000)
>
> Every time someone says "GL HF" I always respond with "Gull Hoof"
> 
> I have no idea what the fuck is wrong with me

Gull Haaf

I stopped saying GLHF after I started plaing ranked last season.

you don't want your opponent to have luck, and if they have fun you probably won't.

{{champion:62}}  "Good luck man"
{{champion:23}} "Same here bro"

{{champion:23}} 5 CRITS IN A ROW AT LVL 1

{{champion:62}} "Fuck good luck..."

The best you can do is say something like "since when did CTRL+F open the shop menu" and hope they burn flash. After that hope for an afk on their team so you can get some free LP.

I would try to be nicer, but I've been on the disadvantage in ranked, so I can't afford it. Now I just grind he game and harvest the salt of my enemies.
I've done that once. Then someone on my team used flash...
Gotta preface it by warning your team, otherwise it's not really helpful.

it goes both ways I have seem teammates blow flash for me saying it...people are dumber than you expect.

Ranked can be merciful, can be polite, but it will never be nice and friendly.
When the enemy says GGEZ but you make a comeback and win
Funny, I always say "Can I get a leash please?" and my laners say "Fuck off" too! They still leash though. I think they just want me to know it's under duress.

{{champion:238}}: GL HF
{{champion:16}}: yeah. okay. I HAVE AN EQUINOX WITH YOUR NAME ON IT. Gank bot. I DARE YOU.
"GET LAG, HAVE FEEDERS"
When you promise to camp them as long as they don't push lane, and then hyper push the whole game.

> [{quoted}](name=Pikachu8091,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=H5lnthX4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-28T19:13:05.763+0000)
>
> When you promise to camp them as long as they don't push lane, and then hyper push the whole game.

this happens to me like each time i say this. -> Never again promise anyone some sort of help. Tell them rather feed and i wont come even then. Maybe they will play less like dumbheads.
and then "wow 0 ganks! report this jungler"
That was me as {{champion:82}} against an {{champion:420}}

I just use

/all QUIIIIIIIET!
good ole gentleman cho' gath.
I just played against a riven who said "GL GG" and then I, as Poppy, proceeded o destroy her.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
http://m.imgur.com/gallery/W0wVY4c

I've always wanted to say "Fuck you, I hope you die and fall" But I realize how incredibly toxic that is and it's far too risky to make a joke at the expense of others happiness.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCj0HGtL1_c
